one_reviews_text:
Hi
it is only intro is playing and stop saying reply or exit .. is this is only on app .. almost 2 GB for intro ?
A great way to realize what vr is capable of.
This short experience is a very very good introduction to Vr in combination with the Oculus Dreamdeck and the other tutorials. The shown Visuals are incredibly impressive. Definetely recommended!

I am new to the VR world and found this to be a sort of entertaining.  It did show me some of the possibilities that VR will offer but with the video being less then quality. The biggest disappointment was the fact that the audio track was totally out of sync with the video and hearing things during one scene that belong in an upcoming scene. This was a total turn off of the enjoyment of learning what VR has to offer.

review_title: Too bad more of VR isn't as good as this
one_reviews_text: Felix and Paul make some of the best VR. I hope they keep up the good work.

I see a lot of complaints about this being "just youtube VR" but that's patently false. At least with a Rift or Rift S, this looks WAY better than anything on the YoutubeVR app. 
Higher resolution and higher framerate makes this look much more realistic, and the 3D effect is very noticeable. Definitely recommend to have a benchmark on what 360º video should look like.

This is just a 360 degree video in poor quality. Even my free VR porns have better resolution.

This could be sooo good if this would be in 4k, 60 FPS.

This was a great short video encompassing many of the values of vr - ability to travel, experience and become immersed in fantasy or reality.

However throughout I experienced bizarre distortions (stretch/squash) in the image when moving my head, resulting in a slightl;y nauseating experience (and I am quite experienced with VR, so this was a surprise!)
Secondly the audio appeared to be completely out of sync for the length of the film. Finishing about 30 seconds early. As there are no settings and no menu to even press play, I could find no way to resolve these issues.
Worst quality VR I've ever downloaded so far. I do not recommend as this can severe turn someone off from VR permenantly.
great video to introduce someone to VR wish the video was a bit clearer but then again im using a DK2 development VR kit
this made me cry just a little bit. thank you

review_title: Who Know what camera was used here?
one_reviews_text: its amazing, beautiful images,,

This is a very short presentation but well made and a great showcase for guests.


(Played with HTC Vive Cosmos on ReVive)
Awesome, definitely going to showcase this for VR guests!
It seems like it would be great if only the video didn't go too slow and go out of sync with the audio

review_title: It would be GREAT if not for..
one_reviews_text: The audio goes faster than the video and gets more and more out of sync, until the audio ends and the video still has lots to play, making it very quiet.

review_title: Perfect for showing friends and family
one_reviews_text: This is a nice and short experience perfect for showcasing VR to people who haven't used VR yet.

one_reviews_text: This could be an amazing intro to VR if they would just fix a couple of issues. The audio goes out of sync about half way through, and I can't get the app to close without shutting down and restarting Oculus. Even with those problems, I'm still thinking about showing it to a friend of mine who is new to VR just because I think she will really like the scenes.

one_reviews_text: It delivers exactly what the title says. In the front-row-seat experience, you are actually on stage surrounded by four different performers. Be sure to look around. The audio is perfectly in sync with the 4K 360-degree surround 3-D video.
A few minutes long, free and cool. The basketball players got in my space!
Audio was in sync for me. Very short experience. 3 minutes maybe. Still cool.

review_title: I would be ashamed to show this to any1
one_reviews_text: I wouldnt show this to anyone whos never been in VR before the audio is completely off sync and all it does it confuse people
I couldn't agree more . "The idea is good"

review_title: Dont let this be the introduction...
one_reviews_text: The idea is good, but the execution is TERRIBLE!! Audio is totally off sync, and it ruins the experience completely.
This was great, but half way through the audio gets off sync.

or just anyone who entered VR for the 1st time ever. There's no interaction but still very immersive and shows the potential of virtual reality. IT's a mix of 4K videos (very high quality) and some graphic (also HQ) visualizations, a great way to introduce sb to VR. And... It's free!

This short Introduction literally made me cry. 
Because of good reasons ;)
WOW
SO this would be absolutely amazing, if the audio was synced up, but it was confusing when the audio was off, and couldn't fix it.
Audio and video sync has been lost with update, needs to be fixed

Video stutters like mad when on the boat.  Elephant to basketball court, de-syncs audio and video every time.  Running GTX 1080 with a 3.3 Skylake, M.2 SSD, and 16GB RAM.
Would be great if it worked.
For being free it was pretty good, very short.
I enjoy this experience and I use it as a demo for friends and family. Perfect VR example to show non-gamers that may not feel comfortable with or get distracted by the controller.

review_title: as a frebie, nothing to complain
one_reviews_text: The video is sharp, better than some I had to pay for, although short, but hey, its a freebie.
Well made assembly of VR videos for rapid-fire experiences. Surpisingly well made. Great for demos.
Free roam would be nice, but sometimes it's nice to sit back and let the experience guide you too. A lot more engaging then watching passively as a TV host shows you another culture.

There is not enough duration. It is not shown that this collection of videos can be called such a loud name. But the most important problem is the total dissynchronization of video and audio: on elephants we hear already basketball players, and the last two videos in general in silence pass. While writing this otsyv, decided to once again lower its assessment. BUT! If you fix everything, you can safely sell it for money.
Was OK for quick showcase, but there's better out there. Mine seemed to be completely out of sync with the audio too for some reason. I watched once then deleted. Worth a look cause its free.

A better title would be "Introduction to 360 Video". It's good. But it gets 2 points less because it focus on only one very narrow point of VR only. On viewing things in 360, but not more than that, showcasing nothing regarding interaction in VR or even movement through VR. It is actually just a short (a bit too short for the size it is) presentation of travelling on some places on earth with the help of VR and being in space and not much more, then the likes. But VR has so many more applications of different kinds, which this is not even touching, unfortunately. So, if it wants to be a presentation of the possibilities in VR (by the definition of the creators) and an introduction to it, then it gets simply not far enough, covers maybe only 20% (if even that) of what VR is and can do, it simply reaches not it's goal. Based on this view, 3 stars are even much. Otherwise it's good and for those relatively new in VR it would be cool to check it out. Just once.
It's free and it works as an introduction to VR. I think this, First Contact, Dreamdeck, and Showdown should be the first things you show people when you demo your Rift.
There are better short introduction to VR than this one.
Wasnt bad since it used real pictures, but it crashed at the end.
First experience in the world of VR it's very good

review_title: first thing you should do on oculus
one_reviews_text: A short teaser video for how amazing future oculus hardware might be.  Worth doing once, but really its an example of how badly we need more resolution and better cameras before "this" is going to take off.
Not as fun as oculus dreamdeck, but it showed off some neat tricks. It slowed down at times, a little boring, so loses a point from me.

The individual scenes are imaginative, interesting, and work great in vr.
However, they are way too short individually, and don't have any kind of overarching theme.
So sure, spend the 5 Minutes to look at this, as it's free. But after that it has overstayed its welcome imo.

My opinion: Stick with the dreamdeck scenes for presenting vr to your friends. They don't have videos, but there is way more substance to them.
Amazing
These F&P videos are currently the best in VR. The quality and content is spectacular and the length is good for today's short attention-spans.

review_title: Looks great but audio out of sync
one_reviews_text: A great demo of how 360 video can take us to places we might never go. But the audio is out of sync, running faster than the video. By the time we're watching the elephants we can hear the audio from the next scene (basketball).
This was definitely a great introduction to virtual reality.  Absolutely stunning.
this is a wonderful app.
It should be called "Introduction to 360 videos". This is not VR.
Dont forget to look all around .. not just in front of you :)
very cool... to use VR on those travel/sightseeing videos.... it will great for people who want to go but can't go can still be able to experience like right there
The concept is nice, but the image quality is way to low for any kind of immersion.

review_title: Problems with the image and sound sync..
one_reviews_text:
More recently, the image is played back in slow motion because of what the sound is significantly ahead of the picture. Please take steps to address this problem. Thank you. 
PS. Sorry for my english, I'm Russian :)
Great Intro Video, but please synchronise the sound. Sound is far ahead of a picture.

review_title: Nice, but I have problem with sound.
one_reviews_text: stuttering sound, but maybe it is just my hardware
good video, but since the last oculus update i have the same problem, desynchronization sound and image

However, it's more like introduction to 360 videos. If you want a real intro to VR, there's still nothing better than Oculus's demo reels: Dreamdeck and First Contact. Good for building hype and inspiration for future projects, but that's about it.
It amazed everybody I introduced into VR so far. Keep up the good work

This small Video is a wonderful tool to
enhance the experience of a beginner in
true VR Worlds.
Just a really nice little experience.
Plkease fix the order of the audiotrack, after 2nd Scene audio  is totally wrong. Basketball Sound during Elephant scene and so on.
A little too much emphasis on National Geographic-style videos rather than the games and fantasy-type environments most people play. Dreamdeck is a much better introduction to VR.
Great way too show of VR to newbies :)
